comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Commonwealth War Graves Commission list following details DICKINSON, HUBERT JOHN Rank:Second Lieutenant Date of Death:20/09/1916 Age:25 Regiment/Service:Lincolnshire Regiment 2nd Bn. Grave ReferenceII. E. 1. CemeteryPOINT-DU-JOUR MILITARY CEMETERY, ATHIES Additional Information: Son of John Edward Dickinson (Capt. R.A.M.C., T.) and Edith Mary Dickinson, of Io7, West Parade, Lincoln They can be found here www.cwgc.org/search-for-war-dead/casualty/257166/DICKINSO... A photography of his grave can be found here twgpp.org/information.php?id=3023328

comment.author: 77235581@N00
comment._content: His regimental number (according to British Army WWI Medal Rolls Index Cards, 1914-1920) was 815.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Temporary Second Lieutenant Hubert John Dickinson was appointed a Regular Second Lieutenant in the Lincolnshire Regiment with effect 5th May 1915. [Supplement to London Gazette 29441 dated 17 Jan 1916].

2nd Battalion Lincolnshire Regiment was in 25th Brigade in 8th Division.  On the First Day of the Somme, 1st July 1916, 2 Lincolns, commanded by Lt Col Reginald Bastard, attacked opposite Ovillers-la-Boiselle - temporarily fighting their way into the German front line fortified trenches but by 8.30am being forced back to their original start line, having suffered 64% casualties, losing 21 officers and 450 other ranks.  At 7pm that evening the battalion was relieved in place by 6th Royal West Kents.  For acts of quite astonishing bravery Lt Col Bastard was awarded a Bar to his DSO.

On 19th September 1916 2nd Lincolns went back into the front line, occupying trenches referred to as the Hohenzollern.  Given the policy of aggressive patrolling to dominate no mans land, it is likely that 2Lt Dickinson was wounded and lost on such a patrol on the night of 19/20 September.//

comment.author: 51462208@N08
comment._content: My Gt Gt Grandad Joseph Staniland was killed on this night he was in the 6th Btn Lincolnshire Regiment. Was this a major assault ? As he has no grave and is remembered on the Theipeval Memorial.
